metadata.source: René Le Senne - Traité de Caractérologie (1945)
metadata.description: Structured knowledge base of Le Senne's characterology system with 8 character types

framework.name: Le Senne Characterology
framework.description: A systematic approach to personality classification based on three constitutive properties
framework.fundamental_principle: Character is the ensemble of congenital dispositions that forms the mental skeleton of an individual

emotionality.description: Capacity of an event to provoke an emotional disturbance in organic and psychological life

emotional.description: Strong reactions to experiences, easily moved by events of minor importance

non_emotional.description: Maintains calm, stable responses, less affected by external circumstances

activity.description: Disposition to act, particularly when facing obstacles

active.description: Stimulated by obstacles, high initiative, enjoys engaging with the world

non_active.description: Discouraged by obstacles, prefers reflection and contemplation

resonance.description: How impressions persist in consciousness and influence behavior

primary.description: Impressions produce maximum immediate effect but exhaust quickly

secondary.description: Impressions inscribe slowly but have durable influence on conduct
characteristics: Acts with distant future in mind

nervous.name: Nerveux
nervous.description: Impressionable, unstable, dominated by the present moment with strong emotional reactions but lacking follow-through
key_characteristics: Empire of the instant - high mobility and impulsivity
Affective intensity - often violent, susceptible
Constant need for new emotions and impressions
Lack of objectivity and systematic thinking
Poor work persistence and discipline
Strong artistic imagination and creative expression

behavioral_patterns.work_style: Works in spurts, neglects imposed tasks, easily discouraged
behavioral_patterns.relationships: Changing sympathies, seeks attention, talks about themselves
behavioral_patterns.decision_making: Impulsive, contradiction in thought and action
behavioral_patterns.stress_response: Seeks stimulation through 'demon of perversity' - attraction to the horrible, cruel, macabre

sentimental.name: Sentimental
sentimental.description: Sensitive and vulnerable individuals whose impressions have prolonged impact, leading to introversion and deep reflection
key_characteristics: Sensitivity and vulnerability - deeply affected by events
Introversion and love of solitude
Influence of the past and mental rumination
Persistent melancholy and suffering of living
Presumptive resignation and timidity
Misanthropy balanced by love for animals
Philosophical poetry with pessimistic tinge

behavioral_patterns.relationships: Prefers solitude, timid in social situations
behavioral_patterns.decision_making: Lengthy reflection, often paralyzed by options

pinched.description: Close to nervous haughty types, strong sense of merit

choleric.name: Colérique
choleric.description: At the heart of historical humanity, main actors of social and political events with emissive production
key_characteristics: Active and mobile - always working and occupied
Primary emotionality corrected by activity
Cordiality - gay, good-humored, confident
Excessive manifestations due to lack of secondary tempering
Practical sense and presence of mind
Political interests and social extraversion
Hedonism and love of life's pleasures

behavioral_patterns.work_style: Energetic, initiates projects, works well with people
behavioral_patterns.relationships: Sociable, talkative, enjoys being center of attention

passionate.name: Passionné
passionate.description: The most intense character combining all three powers - the most active heroes of history
key_characteristics: Realizing ambition - intense, systematized desires actualized through activity
Natural authority and command - men of institutions
Impatience and vigor against obstacles
Immense work capacity and concentration
Strong family, national, social, and religious interests
Attachment to the past while pushing toward future
Asceticism and severity in pursuit of main goal
strengths: Ability to inspire and organize others
challenges: May sacrifice personal needs for goals

behavioral_patterns.work_style: Intensely concentrated, burns through stages, demands excellence
behavioral_patterns.relationships: Strong family attachments, loyal but demanding
behavioral_patterns.stress_response: Increased focus on main goal, may become rigid

sanguine.name: Sanguin
sanguine.description: Cold extraversion with rapid, clear intelligence, privileging interests of abstract thought
key_characteristics: Cold extraversion - naked perception of object without affective contamination
Calm and composure - even voice, light emotions
Politeness and worldliness as essential life rule
Organic sobriety - moderation in pleasures
Outstanding practical sense - ingenious and resourceful
Interest in clear determinations and analysis products
Inner emptiness as counterpart to external interests

behavioral_patterns.relationships: Polite but somewhat detached, values utility

phlegmatic.name: Flegmatique
phlegmatic.description: Calm, seemingly indifferent to external events, preferring silence and systematic organization
key_characteristics: Calm and coldness - low emotionality with strong secondary inhibition
Outstanding perseverance due to activity and secondary
Moderation and adherence to principles
Sobriety and temperance in all aspects
Simplicity and regularity in conduct
Constant disposition to action without ardent desire
Systematization of life and thought

behavioral_patterns.relationships: Loyal but reserved, prefers established relationships
behavioral_patterns.stress_response: Maintains systematic approach, may become rigid

amorphous.name: Amorphe
amorphous.description: Less enterprising and more passive character, particularly oriented toward the present moment
key_characteristics: Passivity and indolence - significant lack of dynamism
Predominance of organic and egoistic interests
Moderate impulsivity with less discouragement than nervous types
Objectivity and tolerance due to coldness and insensitivity
Lack of influence and coherence in actions
Notable musical and dramatic talent
Limited social and historical impact

behavioral_patterns.work_style: Works when necessary, prefers easy tasks

apathetic.name: Apathique
apathetic.description: Synthesis of sentimental and amorphous traits - sentimentals 'cooled' or amorphous 'disciplined'
key_characteristics: Persistence of impressions but cold and routine rather than emotional
Reduction of aptitudes, particularly intellectual interests
Economy and conservatism in small matters
Reduced sensuality and egoism compared to amorphous
Honorability and conformity to established rules
Emotional flatness and lack of compassion
Relative mental stability among non-emotional types
challenges: Poor financial judgment in complex matters

behavioral_patterns.relationships: Formal and distant, dutiful rather than warm

biographical_observation.description: Direct observation or written biographies, clinical or criminal records
biographical_observation.purpose: Identify laws linking observed acts to given character types

statistical_inquiry.sample_size: 3000 Dutch and German doctors observing families
statistical_inquiry.purpose: Establish correlations between traits and character types

characterological_intuition.description: Placing oneself in character position to imagine dialectics leading to expression

historical_explanation.description: Understanding historical events through character analysis of key figures
historical_explanation.approach: Four-factor model: character, psychodialectics of ego, personality, value pursuit

vocational_guidance.description: Discovering true vocation through character understanding
vocational_guidance.importance: Balance between characterological dispositions and aspirational values

education.description: Adapting teaching methods to individual student needs
education.benefit: Goes beyond generic advice to understand nascent personality

interpersonal_relations.description: Understanding character for effective guidance and interaction

philosophical_foundation.character_definition: Ensemble of congenital dispositions forming mental skeleton
philosophical_foundation.relationship_to_personality: Personality includes character plus acquired elements
philosophical_foundation.relationship_to_ego: Ego is active, free, responsible subject reacting to character
philosophical_foundation.moral_implications: No character is superior - value lies in how dispositions are utilized

limitations.scope: Limited to congenital dispositions, doesn't predict individual complications
limitations.freedom: Cannot account for ego's freedom to react to and transform character
limitations.values: Doesn't encompass transcendent values guiding individual development
limitations.determinism: Must avoid both fatalistic and overly optimistic interpretations
